TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit CultureInfoConverter extends System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter

Docs.summary: Provides a type converter to convert objects to and from various other representations.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This converter can only convert a <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo> object to and from a string.
For more information about type converters, see the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class and [How to: Implement a Type Converter](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/visualstudio/visual-studio-2013/ayybcxe5(v=vs.120)).
> [!NOTE] > You should never create an instance of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.CultureInfoConverter> class. Instead, call the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetConverter%2A> method of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor> class. For more information, see the examples in the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class.
## Examples The following code example converts a variable of type <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo> to a string, and vice versa. First it constructs a <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo> variable using the Greek culture (represented by "el") and converts it to the string "Greek". Then it converts the string "Russian" to the <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo> representation "ru".
[!code-cpp[Converters#8](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Converters/CPP/converters.cpp#8)] [!code-csharp[Converters#8](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Converters/CS/converters.cs#8)] [!code-vb[Converters#8](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Converters/VB/converters.vb#8)]

remarks.format:
## Remarks This converter can only convert a <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo> object to and from a string.
The `context` parameter can be used to extract additional information about the environment this converter is being invoked from. This can be `null`, so always check. Also, properties on the context object can return `null`.

Docs.param: An that provides a format context.
Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the list of standard values returned from is an exhaustive list.
Docs.returns: because the returned from is not an exhaustive list of possible values (that is, other values are possible). This method never returns .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `context` parameter can be used to extract additional information about the environment this converter is being invoked from. This can be `null`, so always check. Also, properties on the context object can return `null`.
When the list is not exhaustive, then there are other valid values besides the list of standard values that <xref:System.ComponentModel.CultureInfoConverter.GetStandardValues%2A> provides.
